page.title: 13Farming Shenley & Whaddon
page.content: There are 12 farms in the area, of which only one , Shenley Dens Farm is outside the area controlled by the Milton Keynes Development Corporation which now owns all the other farms. Future development plans for the area cover the eastern half of our grid square, although the farms affected still expect to be working for the next 2 years at least. Farming shows a mixture of types. About half the area is down to cereal crops with only one known field of vegetables. The remaining land is used for grazing, either intensively or for rough grazing and there are both dairy and beef cattle to be found & sheep. Quite a few of the farm buildings are very old. Westbury farm in particular has as its front door a ship's door dating from the time of the Spanish Armada, and has the remains of a moat.
